more_info.origin: A natural polysaccharide, produced from the carob tree (Ceratonia siliqua)  found mostly in the Mediterranean region.
more_info.side_effects: None known in the concentrations used, although high concentrations bring about flatulence and bloating, due to fermentation by the intestinal microflora (in the same way as all indigestible polysaccharides).
more_info.dietary_restrictions: Locust bean gum can be used by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.
